bug.author: cedias
bug.summary: st.plotly_chart legend_title_text is not refreshed on update/refresh.
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
On update refresh of a st.plotly_chart, the legend title is not refreshed and keeps the existing value. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Here is an example of how to reproduce the bug import streamlit as st import plotly.graph_objects as go
def title(): fig = go.Figure() fig.add_trace(go.Bar(y=[10,10,10], x=["a","b","c"], name="a")) fig.add_trace(go.Bar(y=[100,100,100], x=["a","b","c"], name="b")) fig.update_layout(legend_title_text='I have a title')
st.plotly_chart(fig, key="graph2")
def noTitle(): fig = go.Figure() fig.add_trace(go.Bar(y=[10,10,10],x=["1","2","3"],name="rolfla")) fig.add_trace(go.Bar(y=[100,100,100], x=["a","b","c"], name="coulos")) ## fig.update_layout(legend_title_text='I have a title') # Removing the title
st.plotly_chart(fig)
plot = st.sidebar.radio("plots",('title', 'noTitle')) functs = {'title':title,'noTitle':noTitle} functs[plot]() <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
One graph (title()) should have a legend title, the other one should not have a legend title (noTitle()) <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
When switching between title() and noTitle(), the legend title is not refreshed. <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
No <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.61.0 Python version: 3.7.4
